text:
The Surah derived its name from the word an-Naba in the second verse. This is not only a name but also a title of its subject matter, for Naba implies the news of Resurrection and Hereafter and the whole Surah is devoted to the same theme.

Period of Revelation

As we have explained in the introduction to Surah Al-Mursalat, the theme of all the Surahs, from Al-Qiyamah to An-Naziat, closely resembles one another's, and all these seem to have been revealed in the earliest period at Makkah.

Theme and Subject Matter

Its theme also is the same as of Surah Al-Mursalat, i. e. to affirm the Resurrection and Hereafter, and to warn the people of the consequences of acknowledging or disacknowledging it.

When the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) first started to preach Islam in Makkah, his message consisted of three elements: (1) That none be held as an associate with Allah in Godhead; (2) that Allah had appointed him as His Messenger; (3) that this world will come to an end one day and then another world will be established when all the former and the latter generations will be resurrected with the same bodies in which they lived and worked in the world; then they will be called to account for their beliefs and deeds and those who emerge as believing and righteous in this accountability will go to Paradise and those who are proved to be disbelieving and wicked will live in Hell for ever.

Of these although the first thing was highly unpleasant for the people of Makkah, yet in any case they were not disbelievers in the existence of Allah. They believed in His Being the Supreme Sustainer, Creator and Providence and also admitted that all those beings whom they regarded as their deities, were themselves Allah's creatures. Therefore, in this regard the only thing they disputed was whether they had any share in the attributes and powers of Divinity and in the Divine Being itself or not.

As for the second thing, the people of Makkah were not prepared to accept it. However, what they could not possibly deny was that during the 40 years life that the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) had lived among them before his claim to Prophethood, they had never found him a lying deceitful person or the one who would adopt unlawful methods for selfish ends. They themselves admitted that he was a man possessed of wisdom, righteousness and moral superiority. Therefore, in spite of charging him with a thousand false accusations, nothing to say of making others believe, they were finding it difficult even for themselves to believe that although he was an honest and upright man in every other affair and dealing of life, yet, God forbid, a liar only in his claim to be a Prophet.

Thus, the first two things were not in fact so perplexing for the people of Makkah as the third thing. When this was presented before them, they mocked it most of all, expressed unusual wonder at it, and regarding it as remote from reason and impossible, started talking against it as incredible, even inconceivable, in their assemblies. But in order to bring them to the way of Islam it was absolutely essential that the doctrine of the Hereafter should be instilled into their minds, for without belief in this doctrine, it was not at all possible that they could adopt a serious attitude with regard to the truth and falsehood, could change their standard of values in respect of good and evil, and giving up worship of the world, could be inclined to follow the way that Islam urged them to follow. That is why in the earliest Surahs revealed at Makkah the doctrine of the Hereafter has been impressed and stressed more than anything else. However, the arguments for it have been given in
such a way that the doctrine of the Oneness of God (Tauhid) also is impressed on the minds automatically. This also contains brief arguments, here and there, to confirm the truth of the Holy Messenger of Allah and the Qur'an.

After understanding well why the theme of the Hereafter has been so frequently repeated in the Surahs of this period, let us now have a look at the subject matter of this Surah. In it first of all, allusion has been made to the common talk and the doubts that were being expressed in every street of Makkah and in every assembly of the people of Makkah on hearing the news about Resurrection. Then, the deniers have been asked: "Don't you see this earth which We have spread as a carpet for you? Don't you see the high mountains which we have so firmly placed in the earth?Don't you consider your own selves how We have created you as pairs of men and women?Don't you consider your sleep by which We make you seek a few hours rest after every few hours labour and toil so as to keep you fit for work in the world? Don't you see the alternation of the night and day which We are so regularly perpetuating precisely according to your needs and requirements?Don't you see the strongly fortified
system of the heavens above you? Don't you see the sun by means of which you are receiving your light and heat? Don't you see the rains which fall from the clouds and help produce corns and vegetables and luxuriant gardens? Do these things only tell you that the power of the Almighty Being Who has created them, will be unable to bring about Resurrection and establish the Next World? Then, from the supreme wisdom which is clearly working in this world around you, do you only understand this that although each part of it and each function of it is purposive, yet life is meaningless? Nothing could be more absurd and meaningless that after appointing man to the office of foreman and granting him vast powers of appropriation, in this workhouse, when he leaves the world after fulfilling his role, he should be let off without any accountability. He should neither be rewarded and granted pension on satisfactory work, nor subjected to any accountability and punishment on unsatisfactory
performance of duty.

After giving these arguments it has been emphatically stated that the Day of Judgment shall certainly come to pass on its appointed time. No sooner is the Trumpet sounded than whatever is being foretold shall appear before the eyes, and whether you believe in it today, or not, at that time you will come out in your multitudes from wherever you would be lying dead and buried to render your account. Your denial cannot in any way avert this inevitable event.

Then, in vv. 21-30; it has been stated that every single misdeed of those who do not expect any accountability to take place and have thus belied Our Revelations, lies reckoned and recorded with Us, and Hell is ever lying an ambush to punish them and punish them fully for all their doings. Then, in vv. 31-36, the best rewards of those who lived as responsible people in the world and have provided for their Hereafter beforehand have been mentioned. They have been reassured that they will not only be rewarded richly for their services but in addition they will also be given sufficient gifts.

In conclusion, the Divine Court in the Hereafter has been depicted, making it plain that there will be no question of somebody's being adamant in the matter of getting his followers and associates forgiven, none will speak without leave, and leave will be granted on the condition that intercession be made only for the one to whom leave of intercession will have been given, and the intercessor will say only what is right. Moreover, leave for intercession will be given only for those who had acknowledged the Truth in the world but were sinners; rebels of God and rejectors of the Truth will deserve no intercession at all.

The discourse has been concluded with this warning: The Day the coming of which is being foretold, shall certainly come to pass. Do not think it is yet far off, it is close at hand. Now, whoever wills, let him believe in it and take the way towards his Lord. But he who disbelieves, in spite of the warning, "will have all his deeds placed before him: and he will exclaim regretfully: "Oh, would that I were not born in the world!" At that time, his regrets will be about the same world of which he is so enamored today!
description: The surah that mentions The [Great] Tiding of the coming of the Day og Judgment, the truth of which people yet dispute. It takes its name from the expression “the great tiding” (al-nabaʾ al-ʿaẓīm). The disbelievers often asked incredulously about the Resurrection. This surah gives evidence of God’s power, then explains what will happen on the Day of Resurrection, and the respective fates of believers and disbelievers.The surah is also known as: The Announcement, The Great News, The Important News, The News.

Efendi Nahi.verse 78:3: për të cilin ata kanë mendime të ndryshme.
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:4: Jo, jo, ata, me siguri, do ta dinë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:5: E pastaj, sërish, me të vërtetë, do ta dinë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:6: A nuk u kemi bërë ne Tokën shtrat?
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:8: Ne ju kemi krijuar dy lloje (mashkull e femër),
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:9: dhe gjumin tuaj ua kemi bërë çlodhje,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:10: kure natën ua kemi bërë mbulesë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:11: dhe ditën e kemi caktuar për jetesë (ekonomizim),
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:12: dhe mbi ju kemi ndërtuar shtratë qiej të fortë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:13: Dhe kemi krijur kandil (diell) të shëndritshëm!
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:14: Ne, nga retë, u leshojmë ujëra të mëdha (shira)
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:15: për rritjen e drithërave dhe bimëve,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:17: Me të vërtetë, Dita e sqarimit, është caktuar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:18: Dita kur do të fryhet në buri (Sur), e do të vini ju, grupe-grupe,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:19: dhe qielli do të hapet dhe do të bëhet dyer,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:20: dhe malet lëvizin e bëhen si hije e ajrit (fatamorganë).
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:21: Me të vërtetë, Skëterra do të bëhet pusi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:24: në të, nuk do të shijojnë as freskim, as pije,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:25: përpos ujit të vluar dhe qelbësirave,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:27: Ata, me të vërtetë, nuk kanë menduar në dhënie të llogarisë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:28: dhe argumentet Tona i kanë mohuar krejtësisht,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:29: por Ne, çdo gjë e kemi numërura dhe shënuar.
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:30: “Andaj, shijoni, Ne do t’ju shtojmë vetëm dënimin”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:31: E, me të vërtetë, për ata që i kanë druajtur Perëndisë, u janë përgatitur vende kënaqësie:
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:33: dhe vajza të reja, të njëjtës moshë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:35: Nuk do të dëgjojnë atje (në xhennet) biseda të kota as gënjeshtra,
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:36: (ky është) shpërblimi i Zotit tënd, i dhënë sipas llogarisë (së veprave të tyre),
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:37: Zotit të qiejve dhe të Tokës, dhe çka gjendet në mes tyre, Mëshiruesi, të cilit askush nuk do të mund t’i bëzejë (flas),
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:38: në Ditën kur Xhebraili dhe engjëjt do të jenë të rreshtuar, e nuk do të flas askush, përpos atij që do t’i lejojë Mëshiruesi, e që do të thonë të vërtetën.
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:39: Ajo është Ditë e pashmangshme, e kush të dojë, do ta marr strehimin te Zoti i vet.
Efendi Nahi.verse 78:40: Me të vërtetë, Ne u kemi paralajmëruar se është i afërt dënimi, në Ditën kur njeriu do t’i shohë veprat e tija, dhe, kur jobesimtari, do të thotë: “Ah, të isha dhé!”

null.verse 78:1: (Bu müşriklər) bir-birindən nə haqqında soruşurlar?
null.verse 78:3: Elə bir xəbər ki, onun barəsində ixtilafdadırlar.
null.verse 78:4: Xeyr, onlar (qiyamətin haqq olduğunu) mütləq biləcəklər!
null.verse 78:5: Bir də (deyirəm) xeyr, onlar (qiyamətin haqq olduğunu) mütləq biləcəklər!
null.verse 78:6: Məgər Biz yeri döşək etmədikmi?!
null.verse 78:8: Biz sizləri (erkək və dişi olmaqla) cüt-cüt yaratdıq.
null.verse 78:9: Yuxunuzu da istirahət etdik.
null.verse 78:10: Biz gecəni (hər şeyi bürüyən) örtük etdik.
null.verse 78:11: Gündüzü isə dolanışlıq (ruzi qazanmaq) vaxtı etdik.
null.verse 78:12: Ustünüzdə yeddi (qat) möhkəm (göy) qurduq.
null.verse 78:13: Sizin üçün çox parlaq bir çıxar (günəş) yaratdıq.
null.verse 78:14: (Küləklərin sıxdığı) buludlardan şırıl-şırıl tökülən yağmur endirdik ki,
null.verse 78:15: Onunla dən və bitki yetişdirək,
null.verse 78:17: Həqiqətən, (haqla batili) ayırd etmə günü (əzəldən müəyyən edilmiş) bir vaxtdır!
null.verse 78:18: Sur çalınacağı gün (qəbirlərinizdən çıxıb) dəstə-dəstə (məhşərə) gələcəksiniz.
null.verse 78:19: (O gün) göy qapı-qapı (mələklərin yerə enməsi üçün göydə yarıqlar) açılacaqdır.
null.verse 78:20: Dağlar yerindən qopardılıb (havada toz kimi uçaraq) ilğıma dönəcəkdir.
null.verse 78:21: Həqiqətən, Cəhənnəm (mələklərin hazır durub kafirləri gözlədiyi) pusqudur!
null.verse 78:23: Onlar orada sonsuz müddət qalacaqlar.
null.verse 78:24: Onlar orada nə bir sərinlik (görəcək), nə də içməyə bir şey tapacaqlar;
null.verse 78:25: Qaynar sudan və irindən başqa!-
null.verse 78:27: Cünki onlar haqq-hesab çəkiləcəyinə ümid bəsləmirdilər (qiyamət gününə inanmır, onun əzabından qorxmurdular).
null.verse 78:28: Ayələrimizi də elə hey təkzib edirdilər.
null.verse 78:29: Biz hər şeyi (bir-bir) sayıb (lövhi-məhfuzda) yazmışıq (və ya: əməl dəftərində yazıb təsbit etmişik).
null.verse 78:30: İndi (ey kafirlər!) dadın əzabı. Biz sizə əzabdan başqa bir şey artırmayacağıq!
null.verse 78:31: Həqiqətən, müttəqilərin nicat yeri (Cənnət),
null.verse 78:33: Sinələri yenicə qabarmış (dolmuş, tumurcuqlanmış, gözəllikdə və məlahətdə bir-birinə bənzər) həmyaşıd qızlar.
null.verse 78:35: Onlar orada (Cənnətdə) nə boş söz, nə də yalan eşidəcəklər.
null.verse 78:36: (Bu, müttəqilərə) Rəbbindən olan mükafat, artıqlaması ilə verilən bəxşişdir -
null.verse 78:37: Göylərin, yerin və onların arasındakıların Rəhman olan Rəbbindən (göndərilən bəxşişdir). Onlar (məxluqat) Onun hüzurunda heç bir söz deməyə qadir olmazlar!
null.verse 78:38: Ruhun (Cəbrailin) və mələklərin səf-səf duracağı gün Rəhmanın izin verdiyi kimsələrdən başqa heç kəs danışmayacaq, danışan da doğrunu deyəcəkdir!
null.verse 78:39: Bu, haqq olan gündür. Kim dilərsə, (iman gətirib ibadət və itaət etməklə) Rəbbinə tərəf qayıdan bir yol tutar!
null.verse 78:40: Həqiqətən, Biz sizi yaxın bir əzabla (qiyamət gününün əzabı ilə) qorxutduq. O gün insan öz əlləri ilə etdiyi (yaxşı, pis) əməlləri görəcək, kafir isə: "Kaş (bu əzabı görməmək üçün) torpaq olaydım!" - deyəcəkdir.

null.verse 78:1: O čemu oni jedni druge pitaju?
null.verse 78:3: o kojoj oni različita mišljenja imaju.
null.verse 78:4: To nije dobro, oni će saznati sigurno!
null.verse 78:5: I još jednom, to nije dobro, oni će saznati sigurno!
null.verse 78:6: Zar Zemlju posteljom nismo učinili,
null.verse 78:8: i vas kao parove stvorili,
null.verse 78:9: i san vaš počinikom učinili,
null.verse 78:11: i dan za privređivanje odredili,
null.verse 78:12: i iznad vas sedam silnih sazdali,
null.verse 78:13: i svjetiljku plamteću postavili?
null.verse 78:14: Mi iz oblaka vodu obilno spuštamo
null.verse 78:15: i činimo da uz njenu pomoć raste žito i bilje,
null.verse 78:17: Dan sudnji je, zaista, već određen,
null.verse 78:18: Dan kada će se u Rog puhnuti, pa ćete vi, sve skupina po skupina, dolaziti,
null.verse 78:19: i nebo će se otvoriti i mnogo kapija imati,
null.verse 78:20: i planine će se zdrobiti i priviđenje će biti.
null.verse 78:23: u kome će zauvijek ostati:
null.verse 78:24: u njemu svježine neće osjetiti, ni pića okusiti,
null.verse 78:25: osim vrele vode i kapljevine,
null.verse 78:27: Oni nisu očekivali da će račun polagati
null.verse 78:28: i dokaze Naše su pretjerano poricali,
null.verse 78:29: a Mi smo sve pobrojali i zapisali -
null.verse 78:30: pa trpite, mučenje ćemo vam sve gorim učiniti.
null.verse 78:31: A onima koji su se Allaha bojali želje će se ostvariti:
null.verse 78:33: i djevojke mlade, godina istih,
null.verse 78:35: Tamo prazne besjede i neistinu neće slušati,
null.verse 78:36: Gospodar tvoj će ih darom obilnim nagraditi,
null.verse 78:37: Gospodar nebesa i Zemlje i onoga što je između njih, Milostivi, kome neće smjeti niko prvi riječ prozboriti
null.verse 78:38: na Dan kada Džibril i meleki budu u redove poredani, kada će samo onaj kome Milostivi dozvoli govoriti, a istinu će reći.
null.verse 78:39: To je neizbježan Dan, pa ko hoće, Gospodaru svome će, kao utočištu, poći.
null.verse 78:40: Mi vas na skoru patnju upozoravamo, na Dan u kome će čovjek djela ruku svojih vidjeti, a nevjernik uzviknuti: "Da sam, bogdo, zemlja ostao!"

null.verse 78:1: তারা পরস্পরে কি বিষয়ে জিজ্ঞাসাবাদ করছে?
null.verse 78:3: যে সম্পর্কে তারা মতানৈক্য করে।
null.verse 78:4: না, সত্ত্বরই তারা জানতে পারবে,
null.verse 78:5: অতঃপর না, সত্বর তারা জানতে পারবে।
null.verse 78:6: আমি কি করিনি ভূমিকে বিছানা
null.verse 78:8: আমি তোমাদেরকে জোড়া জোড়া সৃষ্টি করেছি,
null.verse 78:9: তোমাদের নিদ্রাকে করেছি ক্লান্তি দূরকারী,
null.verse 78:11: দিনকে করেছি জীবিকা অর্জনের সময়,
null.verse 78:12: নির্মান করেছি তোমাদের মাথার উপর মজবুত সপ্ত-আকাশ।
null.verse 78:13: এবং একটি উজ্জ্বল প্রদীপ সৃষ্টি করেছি।
null.verse 78:14: আমি জলধর মেঘমালা থেকে প্রচুর বৃষ্টিপাত করি,
null.verse 78:15: যাতে তদ্দ্বারা উৎপন্ন করি শস্য, উদ্ভিদ।
null.verse 78:17: নিশ্চয় বিচার দিবস নির্ধারিত রয়েছে।
null.verse 78:18: যেদিন শিংগায় ফুঁক দেয়া হবে, তখন তোমরা দলে দলে সমাগত হবে।
null.verse 78:19: আকাশ বিদীর্ণ হয়ে; তাতে বহু দরজা সৃষ্টি হবে।
null.verse 78:20: এবং পর্বতমালা চালিত হয়ে মরীচিকা হয়ে যাবে।
null.verse 78:23: তারা তথায় শতাব্দীর পর শতাব্দী অবস্থান করবে।
null.verse 78:24: তথায় তারা কোন শীতল এবং পানীয় আস্বাদন করবে না;
null.verse 78:25: কিন্তু ফুটন্ত পানি ও পূঁজ পাবে।
null.verse 78:27: নিশ্চয় তারা হিসাব-নিকাশ আশা করত না।
null.verse 78:28: এবং আমার আয়াতসমূহে পুরোপুরি মিথ্যারোপ করত।
null.verse 78:29: আমি সবকিছুই লিপিবদ্ধ করে সংরক্ষিত করেছি।
null.verse 78:30: অতএব, তোমরা আস্বাদন কর, আমি কেবল তোমাদের শাস্তিই বৃদ্ধি করব।
null.verse 78:31: পরহেযগারদের জন্যে রয়েছে সাফল্য।
null.verse 78:33: সমবয়স্কা, পূর্ণযৌবনা তরুণী।
null.verse 78:35: তারা তথায় অসার ও মিথ্যা বাক্য শুনবে না।
null.verse 78:36: এটা আপনার পালনকর্তার তরফ থেকে যথোচিত দান,
null.verse 78:37: যিনি নভোমন্ডল, ভূমন্ডল ও এতদুভয়ের মধ্যবর্তী সবকিছুর পালনকর্তা, দয়াময়, কেউ তাঁর সাথে কথার অধিকারী হবে না।
null.verse 78:38: যেদিন রূহ ও ফেরেশতাগণ সারিবদ্ধভাবে দাঁড়াবে। দয়াময় আল্লাহ যাকে অনুমতি দিবেন, সে ব্যতিত কেউ কথা বলতে পারবে না এবং সে সত্যকথা বলবে।
null.verse 78:39: এই দিবস সত্য। অতঃপর যার ইচ্ছা, সে তার পালনকর্তার কাছে ঠিকানা তৈরী করুক।
null.verse 78:40: আমি তোমাদেরকে আসন্ন শাস্তি সম্পর্কে সতর্ক করলাম, যেদিন মানুষ প্রত্যেক্ষ করবে যা সে সামনে প্রেরণ করেছে এবং কাফের বলবেঃ হায়, আফসোস-আমি যদি মাটি হয়ে যেতাম।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:1: За какво се питат един друг?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:5: И пак - не! Те ще узнаят.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:6: Не сторихме ли Ние земята постеля
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:12: и съградихме над вас седем непоклатими небеса,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:14: и изсипваме от дъждовните облаци обилна вода,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:15: за да извадим чрез нея зърна и растения,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:18: Денят, когато се протръби с Рога и ще дойдете на тълпи,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:19: и ще се разтвори небето, и ще стане на двери,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:20: и планините ще бъдат раздвижени, и ще станат на мираж.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:24: Не ще вкусят там нито прохлада, нито питие,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:27: Не се надяваха те на равносметка.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:28: И взимаха за пълна лъжа Нашите знамения.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:29: Но всяко нещо вписахме в книга.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:30: Затова вкусете! Не ще увеличим за вас друго освен мъчението.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:33: и с напъпили гърди - девствени връстнички,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:35: Не ще чуват там нито празнословие, нито лъжа -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:36: въздаяние от твоя Господ - достатъчен дар,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:37: Господа на небесата и на земята, и на всичко между тях, Всемилостивия. Не ще могат с Него да говорят
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:38: в Деня, в който Духът [Джибрил] и ангелите ще се възправят в редица. Не ще продумат, освен комуто Всемилостивият позволи, и той правдиво ще говори.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:39: Този е Денят на истината. А който пожелае, да търси пристан при своя Господ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 78:40: Предупредихме ви за близко мъчение в Деня, в който всеки ще види какво е сторил преди с ръцете си. И неверникът ще каже: О, да можех да съм прах!

null.verse 78:1: 他們互相詢問，詢問什麼？
null.verse 78:3: 就是他們所爭論的消息。
null.verse 78:4: 絕不然！他們將來就知道了。
null.verse 78:5: 絕不然，他們將來就知道了。
null.verse 78:6: 難道我沒有使大地如搖籃，
null.verse 78:8: 我曾把你們造成配偶，
null.verse 78:9: 我曾使你們從睡眠中得到休息，
null.verse 78:11: 我以白晝供謀生，
null.verse 78:12: 我曾在你們上面建造了七層堅固的天，
null.verse 78:13: 我創造一盞明燈，
null.verse 78:14: 我從含水的雲裡，降下滂沱大雨，
null.verse 78:15: 以便我借它而生出百谷和草木，
null.verse 78:17: 判決之日，確是指定的日期，
null.verse 78:18: 在那日，號角將被吹嚮，你們就成群而來；
null.verse 78:19: 天將被開辟，有許多門戶；
null.verse 78:20: 山巒將被移動，而變成幻影；
null.verse 78:23: 他們將在其中逗留長久的時期。
null.verse 78:24: 他們在其中不能睡眠，不得飲料，
null.verse 78:25: 只飲沸水和膿汁。
null.verse 78:26: 那是一個很適當的報酬。
null.verse 78:27: 他們的確不怕清算，
null.verse 78:28: 他們曾否認我的跡象，
null.verse 78:29: 我曾將萬事記錄在一本天經裡。
null.verse 78:30: （將對他們說：）「你們嘗試吧！我只增加你們所受的刑罰。」
null.verse 78:31: 敬畏的人們必有一種收獲，
null.verse 78:33: 和兩乳圓潤，年齡劃一的少女，
null.verse 78:35: 他們在那裡面聽不到惡言和謊話。
null.verse 78:36: 那是從你的主發出的報酬——充足的賞賜。
null.verse 78:37: 他是天地萬物的主，是至仁的主，他們不敢向他陳說。
null.verse 78:38: 在精神和眾天神排班肅立之日，他們不得說話，唯至仁主所特許而且能說正話的，才敢發言。
null.verse 78:39: 那是必有的日子，誰意欲，誰就擇取一個向他的主的歸宿。
null.verse 78:40: 我的確警告你們一種臨近的刑罰，在那日，各人將要看見自己所已做的工作，不信道的人們將要說：「啊！但願我原是塵土。」

null.verse 78:1: Nač se vzájemně vyptávají?
null.verse 78:3: o níž se mezi sebou přou.
null.verse 78:4: Však pozor, záhy poznají,
null.verse 78:5: a znovu: však pozor, záhy poznají!
null.verse 78:6: Což zemi jsme jak lože nerozprostřeli
null.verse 78:8: A v párech jsme vás stvořili
null.verse 78:9: a spánek váš učinili přestávkou
null.verse 78:11: a den pro získání obživy jsme vám stanovili
null.verse 78:12: a nad vámi sedm pevných postavili
null.verse 78:13: a lampu oslňující tam umístili.
null.verse 78:14: A z mračen déšť vytlačujících jsme vodu v hojnosti seslali vám,
null.verse 78:15: abychom z ní dali vyrůst obilí a rostlinám
null.verse 78:17: Den rozhodnutí věru přijde v čase určeném;
null.verse 78:18: v ten den na pozoun bude zatroubeno a v zástupech dostavíte se
null.verse 78:19: a nebe se otevře a branami stane se
null.verse 78:20: a hory se do pohybu dají a budou přeludem.
null.verse 78:21: A peklo bude věru na číhané,
null.verse 78:23: a v něm zůstanou věky celé
null.verse 78:24: a chládku tam neokusí ani nápoje
null.verse 78:25: kromě vody vroucí a hnijící,
null.verse 78:27: Vždyť oni v zúčtování nedoufali
null.verse 78:28: a za výmysl Naše znamení lživě prohlašovali,
null.verse 78:29: však spočítali jsme věc každou a pořídili záznam.
null.verse 78:30: Ochutnejte! Nic než trest dnes nepřidáme vám!
null.verse 78:31: Pro bohabojné však je místo blažené,
null.verse 78:33: dívky s plnými ňadry, věkem s nimi stejné,
null.verse 78:35: Neuslyší tam plané tlachání ani žádné lhaní,
null.verse 78:36: odměnou od Pána tvého dar to dobře rozpočtený!
null.verse 78:37: Od Pána nebes a země a všeho, co mezi nimi je, Milosrdného, svolené k promluvě nedostanou
null.verse 78:38: V den, kdy duch a andělé stát v řadě budou, nehovoříce - kromě těch, jimž Milosrdný to povolí a kteří jen pravdu pronesou.
null.verse 78:39: Tento den skutečností je a kdo chce, nechť připraví si k Pánu svému cestu;
null.verse 78:40: a věru varování jsme vám již dali o blízkém trestu v den, kdy člověk spatří, co rukama svýma předtím učinil, a kdy nevěřící zvolá: "Ach, kéž bych jen prachem byl!"

null.verse 78:1: Waarover vragen zij?
null.verse 78:3: Waaromtrent zij (van mening) verschillen?
null.verse 78:4: Waarlijk, zij zullen het spoedig te weten komen.
null.verse 78:5: Nogmaals zij zullen het weldra te weten komen.
null.verse 78:6: Hebben Wij de aarde niet als een bed gespreid?
null.verse 78:7: En de bergen als palen opgezet?
null.verse 78:8: En hebben Wij u niet in paren geschapen?
null.verse 78:9: En hebben Wij uw slaap niet tot rusten bestemd?
null.verse 78:10: En hebben Wij de nacht niet als een mantel gemaakt.
null.verse 78:11: En hebben Wij de dag niet voor (het zoeken) naar levensonderhoud gemaakt?
null.verse 78:12: En hebben Wij niet zeven sterke (hemelen) boven u gebouwd;
null.verse 78:13: En daarin een stralende lamp geplaatst?
null.verse 78:14: En zenden Wij niet vanuit de wolken regen neder die voortstroomt.
null.verse 78:15: Opdat Wij daardoor graan en plantengroei voortbrengen.
null.verse 78:17: Voorzeker, de Dag der beslissing is bepaald;
null.verse 78:18: De Dag waarop de bazuin wordt geblazen; dan zult gij in scharen komen.
null.verse 78:19: En de hemel wordt geopend en zal vele poorten hebben.
null.verse 78:20: En de bergen verdwijnen en worden tot een luchtspiegeling.
null.verse 78:21: Voorzeker de hel ligt in een hinderlaag.
null.verse 78:23: Die daarin lange tijd zullen vertoeven.
null.verse 78:24: Zij zullen daar geen koelte hebben en geen dronk smaken,
null.verse 78:25: Behalve kokend water en een stinkende vloeistof die verschrikkelijk koud is.
null.verse 78:27: Zij verwachtten geen rekening.
null.verse 78:28: En verwierpen Onze tekenen geheel.
null.verse 78:29: En Wij hebben alles in een boek neergeschreven.
null.verse 78:30: Smaakt dus de straf! Wij zullen u slechts hierin doen toenemen.
null.verse 78:31: Voorwaar, er is triomf voor de rechtvaardigen,
null.verse 78:33: En jeugdige gezellen, gelijk in leeftijd.
null.verse 78:35: Zij horen daar geen ijdele gesprekken noch leugens!
null.verse 78:36: Een beloning van uw Heer, een toereikende gave,
null.verse 78:37: Van de Heer der hemelen en der aarde en van alles wat daar tussen is, de Barmhartige. Niemand zal Hem kunnen aanspreken.
null.verse 78:38: De Dag waarop de Geest en de (andere) engelen in gelederen opgesteld staan, zullen zij niet spreken, met uitzondering van hem aan wie de Barmhartige het toestaat en die alleen zal spreken wat recht is.
null.verse 78:39: Die Dag is de werkelijkheid. Daarom, laat hij die het wil een toevlucht bij zijn Heer zoeken.
null.verse 78:40: Voorwaar, Wij hebben u voor een straf die nabij is gewaarschuwd; de Dag waarop de mens zal zien wat hij heeft uitgevoerd en (waarop) de ongelovige zal zeggen: "O, ware ik maar stof geweest!"

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:1: Whereof do they question one another ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:3: Concerning which they are in disagreement.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:4: Nay, but they will come to know!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:5: Nay, again, but they will come to know!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:6: Have We not made the earth an expanse,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:8: And We have created you in pairs,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:9: And have appointed your sleep for repose,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:10: And have appointed the night as a cloak,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:11: And have appointed the day for livelihood.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:12: And We have built above you seven strong (heavens),
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:13: And have appointed a dazzling lamp,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:14: And have sent down from the rainy clouds abundant water,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:15: Thereby to produce grain and plant,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:17: Lo! the Day of Decision is a fixed time,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:18: A day when the trumpet is blown and ye come in multitudes,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:19: And the heaven is opened and becometh as gates,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:20: And the hills are set in motion and become as a mirage.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:23: They will abide therein for ages.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:24: Therein taste they neither coolness nor (any) drink
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:25: Save boiling water and a paralysing cold:
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:27: For lo! they looked not for a reckoning;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:28: They called Our revelations false with strong denial.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:29: Everything have We recorded in a Book.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:30: So taste (of that which ye have earned). No increase do We give you save of torment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:31: Lo! for the duteous is achievement -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:35: There hear they never vain discourse, nor lying -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:36: Requital from thy Lord - a gift in payment -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:37: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and (all) that is between them, the Beneficent; with Whom none can converse.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:38: On the day when the angels and the Spirit stand arrayed, they speak not, saving him whom the Beneficent alloweth and who speaketh right.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:39: That is the True Day. So whoso will should seek recourse unto his Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 78:40: Lo! We warn you of a doom at hand, a day whereon a man will look on that which his own hands have sent before, and the disbeliever will cry: "Would that I were dust!"

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:4: Verily, they shall soon (come to) know!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:5: Verily, verily they shall soon (come to) know!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:6: Have We not made the earth as a wide expanse,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:8: And (have We not) created you in pairs,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:9: And made your sleep for rest,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:10: And made the night as a covering,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:11: And made the day as a means of subsistence?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:12: And (have We not) built over you the seven firmaments,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:13: And placed (therein) a Light of Splendour?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:14: And do We not send down from the clouds water in abundance,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:15: That We may produce therewith corn and vegetables,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:17: Verily the Day of Sorting out is a thing appointed,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:18: The Day that the Trumpet shall be sounded, and ye shall come forth in crowds;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:19: And the heavens shall be opened as if there were doors,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:20: And the mountains shall vanish, as if they were a mirage.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:21: Truly Hell is as a place of ambush,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:22: For the transgressors a place of destination:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:23: They will dwell therein for ages.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:24: Nothing cool shall they taste therein, nor any drink,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:25: Save a boiling fluid and a fluid, dark, murky, intensely cold,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:27: For that they used not to fear any account (for their deeds),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:28: But they (impudently) treated Our Signs as false.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:29: And all things have We preserved on record.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:30: "So taste ye (the fruits of your deeds); for no increase shall We grant you, except in Punishment."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:31: Verily for the Righteous there will be a fulfilment of (the heart’s) desires;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:34: And a cup full (to the brim).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:35: No vanity shall they hear therein, nor Untruth:-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:36: Recompense from thy Lord, a gift, (amply) sufficient,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:37: (From) the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between, (God) Most Gracious: None shall have power to argue with Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:38: The Day that the Spirit and the angels will stand forth in ranks, none shall speak except any who is permitted by (God) Most Gracious, and He will say what is right.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:39: That Day will be the sure Reality: Therefore, whoso will, let him take a (straight) return to his Lord!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 78:40: Verily, We have warned you of a Penalty near, the Day when man will see (the deeds) which his hands have sent forth, and the Unbeliever will say, "Woe unto me! Would that I were (metre) dust!"

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:1: Of what do they question one another?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:4: No indeed; they shall soon know!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:5: Again, no indeed; they shall soon know!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:6: Have We not made the earth as a cradle
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:8: And We created you in pairs,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:9: and We appointed your sleep for a rest;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:10: and We appointed night for a garment,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:11: and We appointed day for a livelihood.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:12: And We have built above you seven strong ones,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:13: and We appointed a blazing lamp
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:14: and have sent down out of the rainclouds water cascading
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:15: that We may bring forth thereby grain and plants,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:17: Surely the Day of Decision is an appointed time,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:18: the day the Trumpet is blown, and you shall come in troops,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:19: and heaven is opened, and become gates,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:20: and the mountains are set in motion, and become a vapour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:21: Behold, Gehenna has become an ambush,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:24: tasting therein neither coolness nor any drink
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:27: They indeed hoped not for a reckoning,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:28: and they cried loud lies to Our signs;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:29: and everything We have numbered in a Book.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:30: ’Taste! We shall increase you not save in chastisement.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:31: Surely for the godfearing awaits a place of security,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:33: and maidens with swelling breasts, like of age,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:35: Therein they shall hear no idle talk, no cry of lies,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:36: for a recompense from thy Lord, a gift, a reckoning,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:37: Lord of the heavens and earth, and all that between them is, the All-merciful of whom they have no power to speak.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:38: Upon the day when the Spirit and the angels stand in ranks they shall speak not, save him to whom the All-merciful has given leave, and who speaks aright.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:39: That is the true day; so whosoever wills takes unto his Lord a resort.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 78:40: Lo, We have warned you of a nigh chastisement, upon the day when a man shall behold what his hands have forwarded, and the unbeliever shall say, ’O would that I were dust!’

Muhammad Asad.verse 78:1: ABOUT WHAT do they [most often] ask one another?
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:4: Nay, but in time they will come to understand !
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:5: And once again: Nay, but in time they will come to understand!
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:6: HAVE WE NOT made the earth a resting-place [for you],
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:8: And We have created you in pairs;
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:9: and We have made your sleep [a symbol of] death
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:11: and made the day [a symbol of] life.
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:12: And We have built above you seven firmaments,
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:13: and have placed [therein the sun,] a lamp full of blazing splendour.
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:14: And from the wind-driven clouds We send down waters pouring in abundance,
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:15: so that We might bring forth thereby grain, and herbs,
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:17: VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false] has indeed its appointed time:
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:18: the Day when the trumpet [of resurrection] is sounded and you all come forward in multitudes;
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:19: and when the skies are opened and become [as wide-flung] gates;
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:20: and when the mountains are made to vanish as if they had been a mirage.
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:21: [On that Day,] verily, hell will lie in wait [for those who deny the truth] –
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:22: a goal for all who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is right!
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:23: In it shall they remain for a long time.
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:24: Neither coolness shall they taste therein nor any [thirst-quenching] drink –
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:25: only burning despair and ice-cold darkness:
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:27: Behold, they were not expecting to be called to account,
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:28: having given the lie to Our messages one and all:
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:29: but We have placed on record every single thing [of what they did].
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:30: [And so We shall say:] "Taste, then, [the fruit of your evil doings,] for now We shall bestow on you nothing but more and more suffering!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:31: [But,] verily, for the God-conscious there is supreme fulfilment in store:
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:35: No empty talk will they hear in that [paradise], nor any lie.
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:36: [All this will be] a reward from thy Sustainer, a gift in accordance with [His Own] reckoning –
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:37: [a reward from] the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Most Gracious! [And] none shall have it in their power to raise their voices unto Him
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:38: on the Day when all [human] souls and all the angels will stand up in ranks: none will speak but he to whom the Most Gracious will have given leave; and [everyone] will say [only] what is right.
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:39: That will be the Day of Ultimate Truth: whoever wills, then, let him take the path that leads towards his Sustainer!
Muhammad Asad.verse 78:40: Verily, We have warned you of suffering near at hand – [suffering] on the Day when man shall [clearly] see what his hands have sent ahead, and when he who has denied the truth shall say, "Oh, would that I were mere dust...!"

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:1: About what are they asking each other?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:5: Again, indeed they will soon know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:6: Did We not make the earth a floor,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:8: And We have created you in pairs,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:9: and made your sleep a source of rest,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:10: and made the night a covering,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:11: and made the day a source of livelihood.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:12: And We have built seven strong (skies),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:13: and created a luminous lamp (the sun).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:14: And We have sent down abundant water from the rain-laden clouds,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:15: so that We bring out therewith grain and vegetation,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:17: Surely the Day of Decision is an appointed time,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:18: a day when the trumpet will be blown, so you will come in multitudes,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:19: and the sky will be opened, so it will become as gates,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:20: and the mountains will be set in motion, so they will be as mirage.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:21: Surely Jahannam (the Hell) lurks in ambush.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:22: (It is) abode for the rebellious people
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:23: who will be abiding in it for ages.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:24: They will taste nothing cool in it, nor a drink,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:26: this being a punishment, fully commensurate (with their deeds).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:27: They did not expect (to face) accounting (of their deeds),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:28: and they rejected Our signs totally.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:29: And everything (from their deeds) is thoroughly recorded by Us in writing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:30: “So now taste! We will add nothing to you but torment.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:31: Of course, the God-fearing will have great achievement,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:33: and buxom maidens of matching age,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:34: and goblets filled up to the brim.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:35: They will not hear any vain talk therein, nor lies,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:36: this being a reward from their Lord, a well calculated grant,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:37: (from) the Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the All-Merciful. No one will have power to address Him,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:38: on the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows. They will not speak, except the one who is permitted by the RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah) and speaks aright.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:39: That is the Day that is sure to come. So whoever so wishes may take refuge with his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 78:40: We have warned you of an approaching torment (that will be inflicted) on a day when one will see what his hands have sent ahead, and the disbeliever will say, “O would that I had turned into dust.”

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:1: About what are they questioning one another?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:3: concerning which they are at variance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:4: No indeed! they will come to know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:5: Again, no indeed! They will come to know!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:6: Have We not made the earth a cradle,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:9: and made your sleep for rest?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:10: and made the night a cloak?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:11: and made the day for livelihood?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:12: and built above you seven mighty ones?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:14: and sent down from the rain-clouds cascading water?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:15: that with it We may bring forth grains and plants,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:17: Verily the Day of Decision is the tryst,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:18: the day the Trumpet is blown and you come in droves,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:19: and the heaven is opened and becomes as gates,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:20: and the mountains are set in motion, and become as a mirage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:22: for the rebellious [it is] a resort,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:24: tasting in it neither coolness, nor drink,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:27: Indeed they never feared any reckoning,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:28: and they denied Our signs mendaciously,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:29: and everything have We kept count of in a Book.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:30: ‘So [now] taste! For We will increase you in nothing but chastisement’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:31: Truly for the God-fearing there will be a triumph:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:33: and buxom maidens of equal age,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:35: They will not hear in it any vain talk or lies —
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:36: [this will be] a reward from your Lord, a gift that is sufficing
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:37: [from] the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Compassionate One Whom they will not be able to address
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:38: on the day when the Spirit and the angels stand arrayed. They will not speak, except him whom the Compassionate One permits, and who says what is right.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:39: That is the True Day. So whoever wishes [to], let him seek resort with his Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 78:40: Lo! We have warned you of a chastisement that is near, the day when a person will behold what his hands have sent ahead and the disbeliever will say, ‘O would that I were dust!’

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:1: What is (it) they are questioning about one another?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:2: (Are they asking) of the Great News,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:4: (That News is) not at all (deniable). They will soon know (that reality).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:5: (We) once more (assert: Dissent and denial are) in no way (right). They will come to know soon.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:6: Have We not made the earth a place to stay for (life) and to earn living and deeds?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:7: And (have We not) erected mountains raised (out of it)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:8: And (ponder:) We (have) created you in pairs (for reproduction).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:9: And We (have) made your sleep (a means of bodily) rest,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:10: And We (have) made the night a covering (by virtue of its darkness).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:11: And We (have) made the day (a time) for (earning) livelihood.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:12: And (now study the spatial universe as well). We built above you seven strong (firmaments).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:13: And We made (the sun a massive) fountainhead of light and heat.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:14: And We poured water in torrents from rain-laden clouds,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:15: So that by means of this (downpour), We bring forth (from the earth) grain and vegetation,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:17: (Observing these signs of Our Might, know that) the Day of Judgment (i.e., Resurrection too) is certainly a fixed time.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:18: The Day when the Trumpet will be blown, you will flock (in the holy presence of Allah) in droves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:19: And the (layers of) heaven will be torn, and (owing to the rip) they will become (as if) all doors.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:20: And the mountains (after being reduced to dust) will be blown off (into the atmosphere); so they will be (eliminated like) a mirage.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:21: Surely, Hell is a place of ambush.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:23: They will abide there for recurrent, infinite periods.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:24: They will taste in it neither coolness (of any sort) nor any drink,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:25: Except boiling water and suppurated fluid oozing (from the wounds of the inmates of Hell),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:27: For they had no fear of Reckoning (on the Last Day) in the least.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:28: And they used to utterly deny Our signs.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:29: And We have preserved everything (major or minor) in writing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:30: (O disbelievers, you excelled in rebellion and disbelief in the world.) Now taste the outcome (of your actions). We shall keep increasing but the torment upon you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:32: (For them) there will be gardens and grapes,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:35: There, these (people) will neither hear any foolish talk nor belie (one another).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:36: From your Lord this is the reward which is an (amply) sufficient bestowal (in proportion to your works).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:37: He is the Lord of (all) the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Kind. (But on the Last Day, the effect and impact of His mighty power and most high authority will be such that) none (from His creation) will dare converse with Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:38: That Day Gabriel (the Spirit of peace and security) and (all) angels will stand in ranks, none able to speak except he whom the Most Kind (Lord) would already have awarded sanction (to intercede) and who also said the right thing (in keeping with the teachings of Islam, during his life of the world).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:39: This is the Day of truth. So, whoever longs may obtain an abode (of mercy and nearness) in the presence of his Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 78:40: We have, indeed, warned you of the impending torment. On that Day, everyone will see whatever (acts) he has sent ahead and (every) disbeliever will say: ‘Would that I were dust (and escaped this punishment)!’

null.verse 78:1: Mitä he kyselevät toinen toiseltaan?
null.verse 78:3: josta he ovat eri mieltä?
null.verse 78:4: Ei, pian he saavat sen tietää.
null.verse 78:5: Vieläkin: ei! He tulevat sen pian kokemaan.
null.verse 78:6: Emmekö ole luonut maan lakeudeksi
null.verse 78:8: Me olemme luonut teidät parittain
null.verse 78:9: ja säätänyt unen teille virkistykseksi,
null.verse 78:11: ja päivän Me annoimme elatuksen hankkimiseen.
null.verse 78:12: Yläpuolellenne olemme asettanut seitsemän vahvaa henkivaltaa
null.verse 78:13: ja laittanut valoa säteilevän lampun;
null.verse 78:14: raskaista pilvistä Me lähetämme vuolaita virtoja
null.verse 78:15: kasvattaaksemme viljan ja kasvit
null.verse 78:17: Totisesti tuomion päivä on määrätty,
null.verse 78:18: päivä, jona puhalletaan pasuunaan ja te nousette joukoittain,
null.verse 78:19: päivä, jolloin taivas aukeaa ja siihen ilmenee joukko portteja,
null.verse 78:20: jolloin vuoret siirtyvät paikoiltaan ja muuttuvat kuin varjoiksi.
null.verse 78:23: he viruvat siellä vuosikausia,
null.verse 78:24: saamatta nauttia viileätä juomaa;
null.verse 78:25: heidän juomansa on kiehuvaa tai jääkylmää,
null.verse 78:26: se on palkka, joka vastaa heidän syntejänsä.
null.verse 78:27: He eivät totisesti uskoneet joutuvansa teoistaan tilille,
null.verse 78:28: vaan sanoivat julistustamme valheeksi, totuutta vääristellen.
null.verse 78:29: Mutta meillä on kaikki merkittynä muistiin.
null.verse 78:30: »Maistakaa siis! Me emme lisää teille muuta kuin kuritusta.»
null.verse 78:31: Totisesti odottaa voitto niitä, jotka pelkäävät Jumalaa,
null.verse 78:33: nuoruutta uhkuvat neidot, heidän ikäisensä,
null.verse 78:35: Ei heille siellä turhuutta puhuta eikä valheita jutella.
null.verse 78:36: Se on Herrasi antama palkka, ansioiden mukainen lahja,
null.verse 78:37: Herran, jonka ovat taivaat ja maa ja kaikki niiden välisessä avaruudessa, laupiaan Armahtajan, jota he eivät rohkene puhutella.
null.verse 78:38: Sinä päivänä, jolloin henki ja enkelit seisovat riveissä, eivät muut saa puhua kuin se, jonka Laupias sallii ja joka lausuu totuuden.
null.verse 78:39: Tuo päivä on totuuden päivä, ja se, joka parhaimman valitsee, turvautuu Herraan.
null.verse 78:40: Totisesti olemme varoittanut teitä lähestyvästä kurituksesta, päivästä, jolloin ihminen saa nähdä, mikä on hänen kättensä työ, ja epäuskoinen huudahtaa: »Ah, jospa olisin maan tomua!»

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:3: au sujet de laquelle ils sont en désaccord.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:6: N'avons-nous pas disposé la terre comme une couche
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:7: et les montagnes comme des piquets ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:8: Nous vous avons créés par couples,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:9: Nous avons fait de votre sommeil un temps de repos,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:10: Nous avons fait de la nuit une couverture,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:11: Nous avons fait du jour le moment de la vie,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:12: Nous avons construit au-dessus de vous sept [cieux] solides,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:13: et Nous avons placé un luminaire éblouissant.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:14: Nous avons fait descendre des nuées une eau abondante,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:15: pour en faire sortir des céréales, des plantes
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:17: Certes, le Jour de la Décision arrivera au terme fixé.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:18: Ce Jour-là, on soufflera dans la trompette et vous viendrez en foule.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:19: Le ciel sera ouvert et nombreuses seront les portes ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:20: les montagnes seront mises en mouvement et deviendront un mirage.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:21: Certes, la Géhenne se tient aux aguets,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:22: comme le lieu de retour pour les rebelles.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:24: sans y goûter ni fraîcheur, ni boisson,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:25: juste une eau bouillante et un liquide fétide.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:27: Ils ne pensaient pas devoir rendre des comptes,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:28: et persistaient à traiter Nos signes de menterie.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:29: Or, Nous avons consigné toute chose dans un livre.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:30: Goûtez donc car, pour vous, Nous n'augmenterons rien d'autre que le tourment.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:31: Certes, pour ceux qui craignent Dieu, ce sera une béatitude :
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:35: Ils n'entendront là ni paroles futiles, ni menteries :
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:36: c'est une récompense de ton Seigneur, un don bien décompté
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:37: de la part du Seigneur des cieux et de la terre, et de ce qui est entre les deux, du Miséricordieux avec Lequel ils ne pourront engager de discussion.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:38: Le Jour venu, l'Esprit et les anges se tiendront debout sur un rang. Ils ne parleront pas, sauf ceux à qui le Miséricordieux l'aura permis et qui diront des paroles justes.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:39: Ce sera le Jour de Vérité. Que quiconque le désire prenne le chemin du retour vers son Seigneur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 78:40: Certes, Nous vous avons avertis d'un châtiment prochain, pour le Jour où l'homme considérera ce que ses mains lui auront acquis et où le mécréant s'écriera : " Malheur à moi ! Que ne suis-je poussière ! "

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:3: à propos de laquelle ils divergent.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:4: Eh bien non ! Ils sauront bientôt.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:5: Encore une fois, non ! Ils sauront bientôt.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:6: N’avons-Nous pas fait de la terre une couche ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:7: et (placé) les montagnes comme des piquets ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:8: Nous vous avons créés en couples,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:9: et désigné votre sommeil pour votre repos,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:10: et fait de la nuit un vêtement,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:11: et assigné le jour pour les affaires de la vie,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:12: et construit au-dessus de vous sept (cieux) renforcés,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:13: et [y] avons placé une lampe (le soleil) très ardente,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:14: et fait descendre des nuées une eau abondante
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:15: pour faire pousser par elle grains et plantes
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:17: Le Jour de la Décision [du Jugement] a son terme fixé.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:18: Le jour où l’on soufflera dans la Trompe, vous viendrez par troupes,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:19: et le ciel sera ouvert et [présentera] des portes,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:20: et les montagnes seront mises en marche et deviendront un mirage.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:23: Ils y demeureront pendant des siècles successifs.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:24: Ils n’y goûteront ni fraîcheur ni breuvage,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:25: Hormis une eau bouillante et un pus
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:27: Car ils ne s’attendaient pas à rendre compte,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:28: et traitaient de mensonges, continuellement, Nos versets,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:29: alors que Nous avons dénombré toutes choses en écrit.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:30: Goûtez donc. Nous n’augmenterons pour vous que le châtiment !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:31: Pour les pieux ce sera une réussite :
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:33: et des (belle) aux seins arrondis, d’une égale jeunesse,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:35: Ils n’y entendront ni futilités ni mensonges.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:36: A titre de récompense de ton Seigneur et à titre de don abondant
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:37: du Seigneur des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui existe entre eux, le Tout Miséricordieux; ils n’osent nullement Lui adresser la parole.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:38: Le jour où l’Esprit et les Anges se dresseront en rangs, nul ne saura parler, sauf celui à qui le Tout Miséricordieux aura accordé la permission, et qui dira la vérité.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:39: Ce jour-là est inéluctable. Que celui qui veut prenne donc refuge auprès de son Seigneur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 78:40: Nous vous avons avertis d’un châtiment bien proche, le jour où l’homme verra ce que ses deux mains ont préparé; et l’infidèle dira : «Hélas pour moi ! Comme j’aurais aimé n’être que poussière».

null.verse 78:1: Wonach befragen sie einander?
null.verse 78:3: Über das sie uneinig sind.
null.verse 78:4: Nein! sie werden es bald erfahren.
null.verse 78:5: Und abermals nein! sie werden es bald erfahren.
null.verse 78:6: Haben Wir nicht die Erde zu einem Bette gemacht,
null.verse 78:8: Und Wir haben euch in Paaren erschaffen,
null.verse 78:9: Und Wir haben euch den Schlaf zur Ruhe gemacht
null.verse 78:10: Und die Nacht zu einer Hülle
null.verse 78:11: Und den Tag zum Erwerb des Unterhalts.
null.verse 78:12: Und Wir haben über euch sieben starke (Himmel) erbaut;
null.verse 78:13: Und Wir haben eine hellbrennende Lampe gemacht.
null.verse 78:14: Und Wir senden aus den Regenwolken Wasser in Strömen hernieder,
null.verse 78:15: Auf daß Wir damit Korn und Kraut hervorbringen mögen
null.verse 78:17: Fürwahr, der Tag der Entscheidung ist festgesetzt;
null.verse 78:18: Der Tag, da in die Posaune gestoßen wird und ihr kommt in Scharen,
null.verse 78:19: Und der Himmel öffnet sich und wird (wie) Tore,
null.verse 78:20: Und die Berge schwinden dahin und werden zur Luftspiegelung.
null.verse 78:21: Wahrlich, die Hölle ist ein Hinterhalt -
null.verse 78:23: Die auf endlose Zeit darin bleiben müssen.
null.verse 78:24: Sie werden dort weder Erquickung noch Getränk kosten,
null.verse 78:25: Es sei denn siedendes Wasser und stinkende Flüssigkeit:
null.verse 78:27: Sie fürchteten keine Rechenschaft
null.verse 78:28: Und verwarfen gänzlich Unsere Zeichen.
null.verse 78:29: Und jegliches Ding haben Wir in einem Buche aufgezeichnet.
null.verse 78:30: «Kostet drum (die Strafe); Wir werden euch nicht anders mehren als in der Pein.»
null.verse 78:31: Wahrlich, für die Rechtschaffenen ist Glückseligkeit -
null.verse 78:33: Und Jungfrauen, Altersgenossinnen,
null.verse 78:35: Dort hören sie weder eitles Gerede noch Lüge.
null.verse 78:36: Eine Belohnung von deinem Herrn - eine Gabe entsprechend (ihren Werken) -,
null.verse 78:37: Dem Herrn der, Himmel und der Erde und alles dessen, was zwischen den beiden ist, dem Gnadenreichen. Sie werden nicht vermögen, Ihn anzureden.
null.verse 78:38: Am Tage, da der Geist und die Engel in Reihen stehen, da werden sie nicht sprechen dürfen, ausgenommen der, dem der Gnadenreiche es erlaubt und der nur das Rechte redet.
null.verse 78:39: Jener Tag kommt gewiß. So möge, wer da will, bei seinem Herrn Einkehr halten.
null.verse 78:40: Wahrlich, Wir haben euch gewarnt vor einer Strafe, die nah bevorsteht: einem Tage, da der Mensch erblicken wird, was seine Hände vorausgeschickt haben, und der Ungläubige sprechen wird: «O wäre ich doch Staub!»
